intro: Horkelia chandleri, commonly known as Chandler's horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its delicate, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellow to pale orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Horkelia chandleri is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and mountain slopes.
